page.title: 01Introduction
page.content: Port Isaac is a very small and pretty village on the north coast of Cornwall surrounded by mixed farmland.It has a harbour at the bottom of the village where most of the fishing trips go out from.The only trouble with Port Isaac is that the hedges are so tall and overgrown that when you drive along in your car you cannot see the beautiful views of the coastline.There is not a lot of public transport and you cannot get into Port Isaac or Port Gaverne by train,but there is a garage calledProuts and that does trips to Truro and places like that.Our nearest big town is Truro about 30 miles away and our centre is Wadebridge, a small market town 9 miles away.The nearest railway station is Bodmin Parkway 18 miles away.
